question.body: One of the main differences between the A-delta and C fibers of nociceptors is the speed of impulse conduction. What glial cell is present for the A-delta fibers and lacking for the C fibers?

response.feedback: Incorrect. While these do produce myelin they only do so in the central nervous system and unipolar sensory neurons are part of peripheral system.
Correct. Because of their presence, A-delta fibers can propagate action potentials by saltatory conduction, making the speed of transmission much faster.
Incorrect. These glial cells are found only in the central nervous system and do not assist with myelination.

Incorrect. While these glial cells are found in the peripheral nervous system, they do not assist with myelination.
